title: Merry Old Maids
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2PRDZkJ

by gaytriangle

Years and years after the Purple Wedding, Sansa and Margaery both find an unexpected happiness in the others arms.

blog.name: thestarkpack
blog.title: The North Remembers
blog.description: An online quiz said i'd be a Stark

summary: that Winterfell plotline in s7 kinda bothered me, i feel like the point of the plotline should’ve been like “they haven’t seen...
body:
that Winterfell plotline in s7 kinda bothered me, i feel like the point of the plotline should’ve been like “they haven’t seen each other for years, can their familial bonds be severed or will they be able to overcome manipulation and become closer than ever” instead of where the actual focus of the plotline ended up being

i feel like that would’ve embodied the Stark’s values of honor and family, like “will those values prevail? or have they been lost after years of separation”

tags: a song of ice and fire
summary: Unpopular opinion: Ned Stark was a bad father to Sansa.
question: Unpopular opinion: Ned Stark was a bad father to Sansa.
answer:
Agree

He wasn’t absolutely terrible, as in he didn’t abuse her or anything like that, and while that seems like enough in a sea of terribly abusive fathers that we see depicted in this universe, it still isn’t. He did nothing to instruct her in how life really is. He was extremely neglectful of her in her stay in King’s Landing, he was actively trying to block her from going to certain things like court that could help in her education, he didn’t explain anything to her after making decisions and chose rather to infantilize her, he clearly showed favoritism to her younger sister and despite the tight situation she was in, he chose not to have a serious one on one conversation that could have helped her a lot in this time where she was divided in her loyalties and was struggling with how she viewed life.

tags: a song of ice and fire
i had a fourth one but apparently it's not an asoiaf pic
summary: Is there any good fanart of Harry Hardyng? Like that you think is close to how he is portrayed in the books?
question: Is there any good fanart of Harry Hardyng? Like that you think is close to how he is portrayed in the books?
answer:
I honestly don’t have much. I never really looked to find some if I want to be honest. I will from now on though. From my couple of minutes research, this is all I’ve found:

1. By Rae Lavergne (looks much older than I imagined, but still a good fanart)

2. By @rosenrot6 (not as handsome as I imagined, but I love how it represents the dynamic between him and Sansa/Alayne very well. Love the costumes, and Alayne looks stunning)

3. By @kieraembers (The hand is quite big, but the face is around what I had in mind. The drawing is cute too.)

tags: im going to start putting hthis tag for my asks
a song of ice and fire
summary: Thank you so much, I'm so happy there is someone as intelligent as you on Team Sansa. I really appreciate you. Thank you!
question: Thank you so much, I'm so happy there is someone as intelligent as you on Team Sansa. I really appreciate you. Thank you!
answer: This really makes me happy. I mean I’m really glad that you think i’m intelligent. Thank you for the compliment. I’m always going to be Team Sansa. Her character moved me so much, and there’s so much complexity in her story and personal arc to dissect. You can definitely expect some actual metas from me  soon enough. I actually just finished an anti-Sansan essay/meta/analysis a few days ago that I’ll post soon. To the person that sent this, thank you again for the kind words and have a good day.

blog.name: athimbleful
blog.title: A Thimbleful
blog.description: ...of salt and other stuff. (Not an asoiaf fan)

summary: "They got all the scripts at the same time, just a couple of days before the table read and then they all tore through them....
body:
“They got all the scripts at the same time, just a couple of days before the table read and then they all tore through them. Sophie Turner got the credit for reading hers first and replying to the showrunners first. The showrunners were saying that it’s so weird to do it this way, because they send it off and then they just wait and they wait and they wait to see what the reactions are gonna be. Because the actors are so invested in their characters and so they’re a bit nervous, you know, sending these out. Because they don’t want people to like, you know, hate it but it’s hard to make everybody happy in such a big cast. And the one person who didn’t deliberately read their scripts was Kit Harington, who went to the final season table read literally knowing nothing. And it was funny for the showrunners because they hadn’t heard anything from him, so they were thinking, ‘Oh, my god. Does Kit Harington completely hate what we did with his character in the final season?’ So they walk into the final season table read and they say, 'Kit! So what did you think?’ And he’s, like, 'Oh, yeah, I hadn’t read it.’ And they were, like, 'Oh, so that explains why we haven’t heard from one of our major actors.’”

- Final season preview - EW’s Game of Thrones Weekly (podcast)

So. Reading this quote, it’s reasonable to assume that the actors replying to D&D first were excited and happy about what they did with their character in the final season.

Sansa’s going to have a spectacular s8, guys.

summary: Why is Sansa getting blamed for the Battle of the Bastards being lost, when it was Jon who abandoned his own battle strategy to...
question: Why is Sansa getting blamed for the Battle of the Bastards being lost, when it was Jon who abandoned his own battle strategy to attack Ramsay head on? I keep seeing this argument that Sansa hiding the Vale cost lives.
answer:
Two reasons:

1) Jon is absolutely perfect at all times. Jon throwing all strategies away to try and save Rickon ignoring Sansa’s warning? A perfect response by a perfect older brother. Jon not giving any instructions to his men as they are slowly encircled? Look at how well he fights. Jon not calming his panicking men and boosting morale as they slowly crushed? Look at how awesome he was fighting Ramsay. Jon fighting Ramsay instead of waiting and reaching out to more Northern houses? Action Hero Extraordinaire. 

2) Not to give Sansa any credit for the win. If Sansa won the battle, then Sansa should have been Queen and Jon should have listened to her.

tags: Why is it always black clothing?
Who would be the perfect Sansa
summary: The new wig is horrific! I’ve been so disappointed with the way they’ve dressed Sansa-what’s that thing hanging from the fur? I...
question: The new wig is horrific! I’ve been so disappointed with the way they’ve dressed Sansa-what’s that thing hanging from the fur? I hope they’ll put more effort for Sansa’s coronation as QITN ;) question-does Sophie fit Sansa’s description in the books? I never read the books but from the fan art it looks like Sansa is meant to be unimposing and soft, almost fragile looking. According to you which actress do you think fits Sansa book description best?
answer:
Dear nonny,

well, I’ve seen better wigs, but I wouldn’t say horrific. At least Sansa the hairline is not too far off and Sophie seems to have some sort of Lyanna hairdo, which is fine. As for her dresses, I really wish Clapton would snap out of her “black period.”

I mean, if you think back to season 1 and the colourful dresses, I really, really wish we would get some colour back. I mean, it’s Winter now, and the situation is dire….. I get it…. But I want some colour…. I hope we’ll get at least one really nice dress…

Does Sophie fit Sansa’s description in the books? That is a good question. I’ve never thought she did not. I mean Sansa is redhaired, blue-eyed, tall, beautiful, that all fits very well. And unlike other actresses I never thought that Sophie would look to differently. To me it is a question of how well the actress is in the role. I mean Rose Leslie is far prettier than the description of Ygritte and yet to me she was Ygritte. Gemma Whelan looks absolutely different than bookAsha and when I first saw her cast I was hugely disappointed. But Gemma made me forget that I had issues about her being cast at first (actually Yara and Asha are kind of two different persons for me by now).

So for me my imagination of BookSansa and Sophie are not too far apart, especially in the first season. We have come far beyond the books, and Sansa has matured into a young woman with self-confidence.

As for fanart, I do think that the fanart is often from the early books, so to say, and I would expect Sansa to look softer, more unimposing and maybe even more fragile. But I must admit that I never picturer her exactly as fragile. That girl survived quite a lot and that is maybe I have a problem with the fragile look as with the sly look. If Sansa looks like a cunning politician I’m out. 

The thing with fanart is, that there are many, many talented artists. Sansan shippers have incredible beautiful pictures, but I must admit that I rarely think “This is how I picture her”. But that doesn’t mean that the art isn’t wonderful. There are many pictures around and many are amazing. That no one has ever struck the “Oh, this is Sansa, as she is in my head”-cord in me, is not the fault of the artist.

As for which actress I want to play Sansa, I am actually very satisfied with Sophie. I think as a teenager she came very close to how I pictured teenage Sansa, and although adult Sophie is not exactly the same as I picture adult Sansa, she is so close and plays Sansa so well, that I don’t have any issues with the actress.

I could picture other actresses, but the thing is that they probably would be too old. I mean Rose Leslie is a beautiful natural redhead, but she gives the vibes of a pragmatic, down-to-earth woman and not a lady. Emily Blunt is one of my favourites, but she wouldn’t come close to how I picture Sansa.

You know, to me the acting skill is more important than the look. Jennifer Ehle was cast originally as Catelyn, and I know I would have loved her, but Michelle Fairley did so well, that I’ve almost forgotten that she was not the original cast.

Lena Headey also looks completely different than I pictured Cersei and yet to me she is Cersei now, even if I still have an image of BookCersei which looks completely different.

Sorry, if it seems like I just rambled, and if I did not explain well, but Sophie for me is a very good Sansa, and for me she is more Sansa than some of the fanart I see around - but that is a very subjective view! And I enjoy the fanart anyway, even if the Sansa is not “my” Sansa.

Thanks for the ask!

reblog.comment:
Dear nonny,

well, I’ve seen better wigs, but I wouldn’t say horrific. At least Sansa the hairline is not too far off and Sophie seems to have some sort of Lyanna hairdo, which is fine. As for her dresses, I really wish Clapton would snap out of her “black period.”

I mean, if you think back to season 1 and the colourful dresses, I really, really wish we would get some colour back. I mean, it’s Winter now, and the situation is dire….. I get it…. But I want some colour…. I hope we’ll get at least one really nice dress…

Does Sophie fit Sansa’s description in the books? That is a good question. I’ve never thought she did not. I mean Sansa is redhaired, blue-eyed, tall, beautiful, that all fits very well. And unlike other actresses I never thought that Sophie would look to differently. To me it is a question of how well the actress is in the role. I mean Rose Leslie is far prettier than the description of Ygritte and yet to me she was Ygritte. Gemma Whelan looks absolutely different than bookAsha and when I first saw her cast I was hugely disappointed. But Gemma made me forget that I had issues about her being cast at first (actually Yara and Asha are kind of two different persons for me by now).

So for me my imagination of BookSansa and Sophie are not too far apart, especially in the first season. We have come far beyond the books, and Sansa has matured into a young woman with self-confidence.

As for fanart, I do think that the fanart is often from the early books, so to say, and I would expect Sansa to look softer, more unimposing and maybe even more fragile. But I must admit that I never picturer her exactly as fragile. That girl survived quite a lot and that is maybe I have a problem with the fragile look as with the sly look. If Sansa looks like a cunning politician I’m out. 

The thing with fanart is, that there are many, many talented artists. Sansan shippers have incredible beautiful pictures, but I must admit that I rarely think “This is how I picture her”. But that doesn’t mean that the art isn’t wonderful. There are many pictures around and many are amazing. That no one has ever struck the “Oh, this is Sansa, as she is in my head”-cord in me, is not the fault of the artist.

As for which actress I want to play Sansa, I am actually very satisfied with Sophie. Sorry, if it seems like I just rambled, and if I did not explain well, but Sophie for me is a very good Sansa, and for me she is more Sansa than some of the fanart I see around - but that is a very subjective view! And I enjoy the fanart anyway, even if the Sansa is not “my” Sansa.

blog.name: mimi0108
blog.title: Mimi0108
blog.description: I feed on cinema, tv shows, books, animals, history, music, travel, photography and especially laughter.

summary: One of the reasons Sansa is my favorite character is her personality.  She was raised to be a perfect daughter, wife and lady....
caption:
One of the reasons Sansa is my favorite character is her personality.

She was raised to be a perfect daughter, wife and lady. She is that girl and, at the same time, has a more rebellious and insolent side. Quickly, she had to hide even more behind her appearance even if, because of the events, her rebellious side begins to express itself.

We see her watching the people around her, judging, holding her tongue, being polite and respectful. And at the same time, she has moments of rebellion.

Sansa is a complex character despite the fact she keeps a lot of things for herself and that these acts of rebellion are more subtle and discreet than for the rest of the characters. But coming from such a “weak” girl, these acts are even more remarkable.

We see her learn from her mistakes but make others . She learns not to trust anymore but ends up trusting some people because she is cornered and needs hope.

Sansa grows up, changes and reflects on her actions and dreams. We see her take a darker path because, in this world of brute, innocence is always tainted. But despite the shadows that inhabit her, she remains virtuous, proud, fair and thoughtful. She did not let herself be corrupted by those who abused her.

Sansa aspires to power now because she never wants to depend on anyone again. However, her desire for power doesn’t equal her love for her family. She doesn’t forget her responsibilities to her people either. Most characters in this show have ambition and seek power. But many are corrupted by this. Sansa, no. She didn’t forget her education, not forget her kindness. She doesn’t let herself being consumed by power. Her ambition becomes a good one. She’ll definitely make mistakes on her way but she really learns and is sincere in what she does.

What’s expected more from a leader?!

blog.name: ladystarks
blog.title: lo, the transforming power of love

summary: uuhhh question how do you think the starks are going to react to theon visiting winterfell and to his bond (idk how else to...
question: uuhhh question how do you think the starks are going to react to theon visiting winterfell and to his bond (idk how else to describe it) with sansa? (if he does visit wf bc i honestly wouldn’t be surprised if d&d just completely forgot about theon’s whole greyjoy/stark struggle and the theon/sansa dynamic also)
answer:
Ohhh I would really love a Theon/Sansa reunion scene!!! Now I’m actually looking forward to something in season 8!

I think that Jon already knows about their bond, and wouldn’t be surprised, but Arya would be angry at Theon at first for betraying Robb, and wouldn’t understand how Sansa could forgive him. I think Theon will do something that makes her understand, though.

blog.name: maisiestyle
blog.title: Maisie Williams | Arya Stark | Styles & Musings

summary:
Arya & Jon’s Reunion according to some Jon/Sansa fans


 Admitting right off the bat, most Jonsa followers, according to...
caption:
Arya & Jon’s Reunion according to some Jon/Sansa fans

Admitting right off the bat, most Jonsa followers, according to @fortunatelylori think Arya and Jon will have problems and a reunion that is fraught with unease and distrust. Like, why? But then again, we all *know* why.👀

This belies one clear fact: Arya truly trusts Jon and she will judge Dany for herself. Some of you guys really give Arya very little credit in this regard. I think we will see a much closer bond with these two in S8 with Maisie fondly describing Jon/Arya’s friendship in a recent interview recapping the whole series that was released last week.

This fact is increased evermore so with the news from Maisie that her S8 storyline will be reminiscent of her S1 storyline where we first saw her bond with Jon highlighted so beautifully. S1 also had no Kill List or Faceless Men arcs so we should be prepared to see those elements in her story fall away and no longer matter as much to her.

After reading the scripts, in a Jan 2018 interview, Maisie said her greatest hope for Arya is to see her let go of her anger and quest for vengeance and find peace. She later said she got to do everything she wanted to do for Arya in S8 and exhausted every aspect of her character. Maisie had to rewatch S1 and she plotted out the beginning, middle and end of Arya’s S8 storyline – so it seems she has much to do! Maisie admitted as much when she was on Jimmy Kimmel and then again in her more recent Guardian interview saying she had more to do in S8 than any prior season of Game of Thrones. That’s very telling!

Plus, the more keen observers who noted how closely inline Kit and Maisie’s filming schedules were this year, with those two filming the most consistently since Nov 2017 to July 2018, wouldn’t be surprised if Arya/Jon have an even stronger bond than *some* people are dreading. According to WoTW new article:  

“They spent 10 months filming six episodes of television, which would normally take about two months. That’s pretty crazy. And a lot of that wasn’t the big battle stuff, but the regular scenes of two people talking in a hallway,” he clarifies". - James Hibberd, Entertainment Weekly writer. He visited the S8 set twice during filming. According to his IG, he was on the S8 set in Belfast: Moneyglass location (The huge Winterfell set) early March. He also saw a very important E6 scene being filmed and he was shocked at who was still there by the end of the season. I’ll talk more about this in a new post!

Arya avenged the Red Wedding in S6/S7 and I think she would take the threat of the NK and the Army of the Dead far more seriously right now (over some politics) and understand where Jon is coming from. Not once have the writers ever shown Arya doubt Jon leading up to their long awaited reunion. If that was their plan, in S7 at least, the writers would have introduced some hint of Arya questioning Jon’s motives or even have her see Sansa’s POV with some merit. Arya has never done that and I doubt she’ll start in S8. In fact, the opposite has happened with Arya *supporting* Jon while the rest of the Lords/Sansa continued to doubt him.

Sansa knows for a fact (as all the viewers do) that Arya would always choose Jon.

Arya avenged the Red Wedding in S6/S7 and I think she would take the threat of the NK and the Army of the Dead far more seriously right now (over some politics) and understand where Jon is coming from. Not once have the writers ever shown Arya doubt Jon leading up to their long awaited reunion. If that was their plan, in S7 at least, the writers would have introduced some hint of Arya questioning Jon’s motives or even have her see Sansa’s POV with some merit. Arya has never done that and I doubt she’ll start in S8. In fact, the opposite has happened with Arya *supporting* Jon while the rest of the Lords/Sansa continued to doubt him.

Sansa knows for a fact (as all the viewers do) that Arya would always choose Jon.
trail.content:
Arya & Jon’s Reunion according to some Jon/Sansa fans

Admitting right off the bat, most Jonsa followers, according to @fortunatelylori think Arya and Jon will have problems and a reunion that is fraught with unease and distrust. Like, why? But then again, we all *know* why.👀

This belies one clear fact: Arya truly trusts Jon and she will judge Dany for herself. Some of you guys really give Arya very little credit in this regard. I think we will see a much closer bond with these two in S8 with Maisie fondly describing Jon/Arya’s friendship in a recent interview recapping the whole series that was released last week.

This fact is increased evermore so with the news from Maisie that her S8 storyline will be reminiscent of her S1 storyline where we first saw her bond with Jon highlighted so beautifully. S1 also had no Kill List or Faceless Men arcs so we should be prepared to see those elements in her story fall away and no longer matter as much to her.

After reading the scripts, in a Jan 2018 interview, Maisie said her greatest hope for Arya is to see her let go of her anger and quest for vengeance and find peace. She later said she got to do everything she wanted to do for Arya in S8 and exhausted every aspect of her character. Maisie had to rewatch S1 and she plotted out the beginning, middle and end of Arya’s S8 storyline – so it seems she has much to do! Maisie admitted as much when she was on Jimmy Kimmel and then again in her more recent Guardian interview saying she had more to do in S8 than any prior season of Game of Thrones. That’s very telling!

Plus, the more keen observers who noted how closely inline Kit and Maisie’s filming schedules were this year, with those two filming the most consistently since Nov 2017 to July 2018, wouldn’t be surprised if Arya/Jon have an even stronger bond than *some* people are dreading. According to WoTW new article:  

“They spent 10 months filming six episodes of television, which would normally take about two months. That’s pretty crazy. And a lot of that wasn’t the big battle stuff, but the regular scenes of two people talking in a hallway,” he clarifies". - James Hibberd, Entertainment Weekly writer. He visited the S8 set twice during filming. According to his IG, he was on the S8 set in Belfast: Moneyglass location (The huge Winterfell set) early March. He also saw a very important E6 scene being filmed and he was shocked at who was still there by the end of the season. I’ll talk more about this in a new post!

Arya avenged the Red Wedding in S6/S7 and I think she would take the threat of the NK and the Army of the Dead far more seriously right now (over some politics) and understand where Jon is coming from. Not once have the writers ever shown Arya doubt Jon leading up to their long awaited reunion. If that was their plan, in S7 at least, the writers would have introduced some hint of Arya questioning Jon’s motives or even have her see Sansa’s POV with some merit. Arya has never done that and I doubt she’ll start in S8. In fact, the opposite has happened with Arya *supporting* Jon while the rest of the Lords/Sansa continued to doubt him.

Sansa knows for a fact (as all the viewers do) that Arya would always choose Jon.

Arya & Jon’s Reunion according to some Jon/Sansa fans

Admitting right off the bat, most Jonsa followers, according to @fortunatelylori think Arya and Jon will have problems and a reunion that is fraught with unease and distrust. Like, why? But then again, we all *know* why.👀

This belies one clear fact: Arya truly trusts Jon and she will judge Dany for herself. Some of you guys really give Arya very little credit in this regard. I think we will see a much closer bond with these two in S8 with Maisie fondly describing Jon/Arya’s friendship in a recent interview recapping the whole series that was released last week.

summary: Where had the rest of them gone? Sansa wondered. Vainly, she searched for friendly faces. Not one of them would meet her eyes....
caption: Where had the rest of them gone? Sansa wondered. Vainly, she searched for friendly faces. Not one of them would meet her eyes. It was as if she had become a ghost, dead before her time. (happy birthday @ppumpkines ♡)
